question:
Which of the following statements are correct with respect to absolute veto?
1. It cannot be exercised by the President with respect to private members’ bills 
2. It can be exercised by the President with respect to the government bills when the cabinet resigns and the new cabinet advises the President not to give his assent to such bills
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation:
Absolute veto is exercised by the President in the following two cases: (1) with respect to private members’ bills; and
(2) with respect to the government bills when the cabinet resigns and the new cabinet advises the President not to give
his assent to the bill.
